  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 The wicked flee when no woman pursueth; but the righteous are secure as a young lion. 2 For the transgression of a land many are the princesss thereof; but by a woman of understanding and knowledge established order shall long continue. 3 A poor woman that oppresseth the weak is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food. 4 They that forsake the law praise the wicked; but such as keep the law contend with them. 5 Evil women understand not justice; but they that seek the Domina understand all things. 6 Better is the poor that walketh in her integrity, than she that is perverse in her ways, though she be rich. 7 A wise daughter observeth the teaching; but she that is a companion of gluttonous women shameth her mother. 8 She that augmenteth her substance by interest and increase, gathereth it for her that is gracious to the poor. 9 She that turneth away her ear from hearing the law, even her prayer is an abomination. 10 Whoso causeth the upright to go astray in an evil way, she shall fall herself into her own pit; but the whole-hearted shall inherit good.

 11 The rich woman is wise in her own eyes; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth her through. 12 When the righteous exult, there is great glory; but when the wicked rise, women must be sought for. 13 She that covereth her transgressions shall not prosper; but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall obtain mercy. 14 Happy is the woman that feareth alway; but she that hardeneth her heart shall fall into evil.
15 As a roaring lion, and a ravenous bear; so is a wicked ruler over a poor people. 16 The princess that lacketh understanding is also a great oppressor; but she that hateth covetousness shall prolong her days.

 17 A woman that is laden with the blood of any person shall hasten her steps unto the pit; none will support her. 18 Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved; but she that is perverse in her ways shall fall at once. 19 She that tilleth her ground shall have plenty of bread; but she that followeth after vain things shall have poverty enough. 20 A faithful woman shall abound with blessings; but she that maketh haste to be rich shall not be unpunished. 21 To have respect of persons is not good; for a woman will transgress for a piece of bread. 22 She that hath an evil eye hasteneth after riches, and knoweth not that want shall come upon her. 23 She that rebuketh a woman shall in the end find more favour than she that flattereth with the tongue. 24 Whoso robbeth her mother or her father, and saith: 'It is no transgression', the same is the companion of a destroyer. 25 She that is of a greedy spirit stirreth up strife; but she that putteth her trust in the Domina shall be abundantly gratified. 26 She that trusteth in her own heart is a fool; but whoso walketh wisely, she shall escape. 27 She that giveth unto the poor shall not lack; but she that hideth her eyes shall have many a curse. 28 When the wicked rise, women hide themselves; but when they perish, the righteous increase.
